title: Sales Associate-Nordic Region
description:
**About Northern Trust**
 Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
   

  

 Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm and has primary support for the sales manager in location and ad-hoc support to the rest of the EMEA team.
   

  

 The Sales Associate will support the EMEA Sales Team in achieving annual targets by focusing on business development.
   

  

 A key responsibility for this role includes producing the weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting that is required.
   

  

**Additional Responsibilities Include**
* Targeting new business from Pensions, Insurance, Corporate/ Baking, OCIO/ Fiduciary Management, Traditional Asset Management and Alternative Asset Management sectors.
* Maintaining up to date market research of target markets/sectors.
* Supporting the RFP (Request for Proposal) and sales teams to gather accurate information from the business and reviews RFP responses to ensure it is customised to prospects needs.
* Supporting the preparation of commercials and following fee review process.
* Liaising with other SMEs (Subject Matter Experts) across Northern Trust to support RFP responses, gather FTE requests and work with Deal Manager to prepare for due diligence preparation
* Maintaining up to date market research of target markets/sectors and research new markets/sectors of interest to Northern Trust.
* Researching prospect profile and work alongside sales managers on key deals to build value propositions specific to each prospect.
* Managing and preparing the fee model/proposals for EMEA sales and ensure that all required supporting documentation is in place and regularly checked for updates.
* Ensuring that the fee review process is strictly adhered to.
* Supporting and coordinating all aspects relating to sales presentations such as presentation booklets, supporting sales collateral, agendas, etc.
* Supporting the Deal Manager for due diligence preparation.
* Maintaining up-to-date client data within CRM databases, keep accurate records, support call report completion/filing and run periodic reports as required.
* Producing sales reports on a regular and ad hoc basis as required by senior management. Collaborating with the US Sales Team on global reporting and initiatives.
* Analysing prospect data to assist sales team focus on target markets/prospects, differentiators and product gaps.
* Developing a working knowledge of the products that Northern Trust offer, attending product and training sessions.


 The preferred candidate should have a fair amount of the following qualities:
   

  

* Strong numerate and literacy skills.
* Knowledge of financial products and services and basic sales concepts usually obtained through related work experience or formal education
* Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and intermediate skills in PowerPoint.
* Good communication skills: written, verbal and non-verbal to interact with stakeholders/clients.
* Demonstrated ability to work well under pressure and work to tight deadlines.
* Strong level of attention to detail and time management.
* Strong analytical and organizational skills.
* Demonstrated ability to prioritize daily workloads, working efficiently and accurately under pressure.
* To act with integrity at all times and embrace the philosophy of treating customers fairly
* Demonstration of initiative, accountability and focus on quality


**Working With Us**
 As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.
   

  

 Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.
   

  

 We’d love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world’s most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreater
   

  

**Reasonable accommodation**
 Northern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at MyHRHelp@ntrs.com.
   

  

 We hope you’re excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.
   

  

 Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.

title: Senior Project Manager Structural Engineering #Your Next Project
description:
**Are you an experienced, motivated Project Manager? Are you ready to play a central role in shaping and developing our thriving structural engineering department at COWI? Join us now to contribute to challenging and exciting construction projects!**






  

  
   

  





  




**Come work with us at Industry and Building** 
  

  








  




 Join our Industry and Building team at COWI. We excel in delivering both multidisciplinary assignments and projects within specific disciplines to our valued clients. As trusted partners, we guide our clients throughout the entire process - from conceptualization to managing diverse property portfolios. Our expertise covers Building Technology, Project Management, HVAC and Energy Technology, as well as Electrical Engineering and Facility Support.
   

  








  




 Our Structural Engineering group in Solna is growing, and we see a high demand for our services. In this role as Senior Project Manager, you will work closely with colleagues and clients. Your primary task within the team is to lead the structural discipline in our property-related projects. Often, these projects require collaboration with other discipline project managers, and you will have a significant role in coordinating their work.
   

  








  




 Your key responsibilities and tasks will include:
 





* Leading the planning and execution of multidisciplinary building projects
* Establishing yourself as the go-to expert in construction engineering for colleagues and clients
* Be committed to up- and reskilling of employees through mentorship
* Contributing to business development efforts within the buildings sector



  




**Your skills. Our team. Together we create the future**
 The first step to success in this role is that you are eager to collaborate with the people around you, whether they are colleagues, partners or customers. Developing ties with others is something you do by acting respectfully and delivering on your promises. And you never get set in your ways, but keep exploring new insights and ways to improve.
   

  








  




 On top of that, you will have:
 





* Relevant education in construction and/or structural engineering.
* Several years of experience as a project manager in construction and structural design.
* Proven ability to collaborate with colleagues across our Swedish and Lithuanian offices
* Ability to communicate effectively in both English and Swedish language.



  




**A place to work and so much more**
 At COWI, we work together with our customers to shape a sustainable and liveable world. We do it by applying our knowledge and curiosity - and sometimes even our courage - to create the solutions the world needs today to enable a better tomorrow. That is why we say no to fossil-based projects and aspire to have 100% of our revenue come from activities that move our customers towards sustainability.
   

  








  




 We value differences and development and cultivate an environment of belonging and having fun. Because that is what brings out the best in you, at work and at home.
   

  








  




 With offices primarily located in the Nordic region, the UK, North America and India, we are currently more than 8,000 people who bring their expertise in engineering, architecture, energy and environment into play.
   

  








  

  
   

  





  




**Do you have questions?**
 If you have any unanswered questions about the role or what we have to offer, please reach out to Head of Buildings East, Sara Linder salr@cowi.com or Talent Acquisition Specialist, Sara Kuikka
 

 srki@cowi.com
 




 .
 


  
   

  

 Get to know us even better at our website, www.cowi.com
 

 ,
 

 where you can learn more about our projects, our strategy, what we want to achieve and what life is like at COWI.
   

  








  

  
   

  





  




 We do our utmost to ensure that our recruitment process is as fair and unbiased as possible. You can help us by not including a photo in your CV when you apply.

title: 2D Artist
description:
Do you want to work in a fun environment, alongside with a team of talented artists, to deliver content for millions and millions of happy kids?
   

  

 As an Artist in Toca Boca World’s content teams, you’ll create quirky characters and colorful environments, in line with a fun and playful art style that is constantly evolving.
   

  

 You’ll join a creative and friendly studio, where diversity and inclusion are core values!
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 You’ll work closely with the rest of the artists and the Lead Artist in your team to maintain and improve the visual quality in Toca Boca World, and deliver high quality assets for one of the most popular kids’ apps in the world. You’ll take an active part in the ideation and concept work, attend creative workshops and sketch sessions. You’ll also be working with the developers, level implementors, QA and producer in your team. Together you will have daily meetings, discuss priorities and dependencies, and together build the amazing product that Toca Boca World is.
   

  

 You’ll produce art assets that include pieces of furniture and home decor, clothes and other items that enable our players to express themselves. You’ll join the team for the morning daily meetings, discuss priorities and dependencies, sync with other artists and with the developers who will implement your art into the game.
   

  

**Is this you?**
 We are looking for both junior and experienced artists that are proficient in Adobe Illustrator and have a strong portfolio fitting the Toca Boca World art style.
   

  

 Maybe you have recently graduated or worked a year or so with digital art production in a game studio, ad agency or similar. Or, you have a few years experience of the same.
   

  

 You bring your individuality and personal style at work in the art assets creation, while adapting to the Toca Boca Creative Principles like diversity and unisex, quirkiness, attention to details and kids perspective.
   

  

 You can follow creative direction and will happily share your work explaining your creative process. You are open to feedback and the perspective of others, and love collaborating with different people in your team. You also deliver your own feedback in a constructive and friendly manner.
   

  

**What We’ll Be Looking For In Portfolio**
* A 2D Illustration style that can translate well into Toca Boca World (vector style illustrations)
* Illustrations that show an understanding of colour and composition
* Personal projects and your personal style
* Your Adobe Illustrator skills


 Your portfolio will play a key role during our selection process, so we recommend that you make sure it’s up to date and includes what we’re looking for.
   

  

**This is us!**
 Play is in our DNA. At Toca Boca, we make playful, safe spaces where kids can have fun and feel free to be themselves. Over 60 million kids from all over the world play our games every month. Toca Boca World is our biggest game yet, with multiplayer game Toca Boca Days launching in select markets through 2024. Are you in? Let’s play.
   

  

**Good to know!**
 This position is full time and based in our Stockholm office with a hybrid working model (part office, part working from home). You need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support relocation or offer remote work. We apply a 6 month probationary period. As we’re an international company, with over 20 nationalities working here, and millions of users all over the world, you have to be fluent in English. Your application should therefore be in English.

title: Danish Business Development Representatives to Reliable AB!
description:
Do you speak Danish and have an interest in customer relations and business development? If you are looking for a role where you can develop your sales ability and gain relevant experience, this is the role for you! Apply today as we work with ongoing selection.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Reliable AB
 



  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Sales
 



  

**Extent :**
 Part time, 1-3 days a week, 50h/month minimum
 



  

**Start date :**
 End of August 2024
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Reliable AB staff develop their sales assignments with niche talent recruitment, directly from universities and colleges. They work in a youthful environment with unique conditions to be able to staff and optimize results for all types of sales assignments. Every customer contact is a marketing opportunity and they place great importance in the person who represents a customer always having a relevant education, knows the market, the company and the product it represents. In this role your main responsibility will be to book appointments for Reliable's customers, and offer them the best conditions for their business growth.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* **An exciting experience where you can develop your sales skills**
  
* **A dedicated consultant manager to help and guide you in your role and future career path**
  
* **A competitive salary with the possibility of a generous provision salary**
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Prospecting and lead generation: Identify and research potential clients or partners through various channels
  
* Relationship Building: Develop and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and ensuring exceptional service delivery
  
* Pipeline Management: Manage and update the CRM system, keeping accurate records of interactions, leads, and opportunities
  
* Booking meetings: Putting clients together with their prospects and organizing these meetings.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* An ongoing tertiary education, with at least one year left of studies, of at least 50% study rate
  
* High speaking and written proficiency in Danish
  
* An interest in business development, sales, and customer relations
  
* Previous experience from sales or customer service
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Self-developer
  
* Service-minded
  
* Results-oriented
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Reliable AB**

 Read more about Reliable AB here.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Emma Nydén or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sts05@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105334

title: Product Owner - Information Security
description:
*We are Zeekr Technology Europe. Powered by engineers and creative minds from all over the world. Located in Gothenburg, Sweden, one of the leading mobility innovation grounds worldwide. Established in 2013 as CEVT and began with the mission to create a revolutionary modular vehicle architecture, CMA. As of 2024, CEVT is now Zeekr Technology Europe, signaling our belonging within Zeekr. Delivering intelligent, sustainable, and user centric technology and software for tomorrow's electric mobility today.*

**About This Opportunity**


As a Product Owner for Information security, you will join the Enterprise Digital department within Digital Development & Operations (DDO). We are on a journey, together as a global team, establishing ZEEKR in Europe and Globally with digital capabilities. The overall DDO vision is to be an innovator, a transformative leader, and an enabler for reaching our business objectives.


The area of Enterprise digital consists of several product areas which are: Collaboration, Big data, Cloud & DevOps, Enterprise architecture, PMO, Information security, and Service portfolio. As a product owner, you will lead one of the areas and the teams within.


**Information security consists of below key areas:**

* Information security – ISO27001 & NSIT
* Business continuity
* Risk management
* SOX compliance
* Security operations center
* Enterprise architecture
* Privacy architecture

**What You Will Do**  

  

The product owner is responsible for identifying the customer needs and the larger business objectives that a product, feature, or area will fulfill, articulates what success looks like for a product, and rallies a team to turn that vision into a reality.

* Lead and manage teams consisting of professionals; provide guidance, mentorship and ensure motivated and high-performing teams.
* Define & develop the vision and strategy for the product area in line with business objectives.
* Conduct market research to understand business needs, industry trends, and competitive landscapes.
* Define performance indicators to measure the success of the area and to enable data-driven decision-making and continuous improvements.
* Create and maintain a product roadmap that outlines the planned features and enhancements over time.
* Prioritize features based on business value, customer impact, and resource constraints.
* Ensure close cross-collaboration between enabling teams from different product areas globally.
* Clearly define and document product requirements, ensuring that the team understands the goals and objectives.
* Engage with key stakeholders, including executives, business teams, and internal IT teams, to gather input and build support for the product.
* Maintain a deep understanding of the business needs and pain points.

**You will bring**  

  

We expect you to be the kind of person that thrives in an environment where not everything is set and a solution needs to be defined, prototyped, and implemented with emphasis on automation, speed, and reliability. We believe that a DevOps approach and culture will be the key to success in the collaboration. We see that you have:

* Strong leadership skills to guide and motivate a team of professionals with the ability to delegate tasks, set goals, and provide feedback and support.
* Experience working as a product manager or product owner within Digital/IT areas.
* Proven experience from leading information security or secops areas.
* In-depth knowledge of ISO27001 and NIST frameworks.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Holistic view and capability to understand IT Services in a business context.
* Knowledge of DevOps culture, Agile processes, and principles.
* A team mindset and an outgoing personality with the ability to guide and inspire others. The team is located in Gothenburg, Lindholmen but works with teams and stakeholders all over the world.

**Why you should join Zeekr Technology Europe**  

  

We are engineers, developers, and innovators from around the world. Joined together by entrepreneurship, our unique blend of global culture, and a belief in a smarter more sustainable future. At Zeekr Technology Europe we fast-track innovation and transform ideas into pioneering technology solutions, doing your master thesis here is no different. We are convinced that a thesis project is a major contribution to our innovation capabilities and long-term development. You'll have a great opportunity to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what´s possible.  

  

**What Happens When You Apply**  

  

If this sounds interesting and you match the requirements, please don't hesitate to submit your application with a CV and cover letter. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview to further discuss the project's details and expectations.

**Last application date: 2024-08-18**  

  

**Do you want to join us on our journey? Welcome, to contact us for more information**  

Valjon Hasani, Head of Enterprise Digital, valjon.hasani@cevt.se for questions regarding the position  

Kristina Larsson Djokovic, Senior Recruiter, kristina.larsson@cevt.se for questions regarding the recruitment process

  

Please note that due to **GDPR**, **we can only accept applications and CVs sent through the recruitment system**, not via email or other channels.

**Working at Zeekr Technology Europe**


More than 900 researchers and engineers in Gothenburg, Sweden. Delivering intelligent, sustainable, and user centric technology and software for tomorrow's electric mobility today. We thrive on speed, innovation, and collaboration. We aim to adapt and lead change. Join our vibrant team now.

* *Supportive and creative work environment*
* *30 days of vacation and additional 8 days paid ATK- days annually*
* *Annual STI program to reward your performance*
* *Flexible workplace with possibility to work from home 2 days a week*

*#LI-KLD*

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Is “to improve things” your middle name, and do you want to be part of an exciting journey? We are now recruiting a new team member to IT Operations! To reach our vision at ATG IT and deliver world class business innovations, we in the operations department have started the journey of adopting to ATG IT’s product centric approach. By this we will increase our efforts and skills in automation, in cloud usage, and of course service delivery. A central part of this effort is our Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) team.


**In this role you will:**  

* Maintain System Availability: Ensure our systems are up and running, minimizing downtime
* Accelerate Feature Deployment: Reduce time to market for new features, enhancing system performance
* Monitor and Troubleshoot: Use and develop tools for monitoring, troubleshooting, and quality assurance
* Incident Management: Rapidly resolve incidents, conduct root cause analysis, and implement preventive measures
* Tool Development and Automation: Create and automate tools, and share knowledge with IT colleagues at ATG

**Is this you?**  

We are looking for a senior site reliability engineer colleague who is very skilled when it comes to analysing complex issues in a micro service architecture and has good coding/scripting experience! Besides this we trust that you have an eye for details, are proactive and triggered by problem solving. Good communication and cooperation skills are essential in this role, as we will have close dialogue with many different colleagues from different sections at ATG, such as Development and Architecture. A DevOps mindset and a great interest for technologies within your area and generally in IT is a big advantage. On-calls will be a part of your duty and will rotate in the team.


We also see that you have:
  

* A good general understanding of distributed systems and micro service architecture
* Solid technical background in IT system development/system administration
* Software engineering background and/or experience in tool development, e.g., Python, Go lang, JavaScript, Java or Kotlin
* Experience working with Application Performance Monitoring tools, e.g., Dynatrace or other monitoring/metrics tools e.g., Prometheus and Grafana
* Experience working with centralized logging platforms, e.g., Splunk
* Experience working with container orchestration, e.g., OpenShift or Kubernetes
* Experience working with Public Cloud, e.g., AWS

**"I started at ATG in 2019 with the assignment to start up the SRE function"**  

I really enjoy working with this team of bright people where we come together to analyze and solve problems or potential issues. We work in an agile way where everyone contributes and takes responsibility for their parts. I have a background as a developer and really enjoy deep diving into technical issues. I have also worked extensively as a manager of development teams and like to coach teams to bring out their full potential.  

* **Recruting manager, Erik Änggård, Manager IT SRE**

**We are the game**  

For almost 50 years, ATG has been delivering excitement and entertainment to the people of Sweden. Our motivation is to safeguard the Swedish equine industry, and to continue being a responsible gambling company at the cutting edge. Our vision to deliver the world's best gambling experience. With us, you're part of an innovative environment – using the latest technology to develop world-class gambling experiences. Self-leadership and competence development are important to us. Since the beginning, in 1974, we have built and managed the systems for our products, which handle 4,500,000 transactions per day.


**Join the game!**  

You are welcome to submit your application either via our recruitment portal or using your LinkedIn profile – whichever is easiest and most convenient for you. Feel free to read more about us on our careers page, and don't hesitate to get in touch if you have any questions about the position.


We apply a 6 month probationary period, and perform background checks for all roles. The position is full-time, and based at our office at Solvalla, right next to the racecourse. We work flexibly, which means that you’ll have the opportunity to combine remote working with working from the office, depending on the role. Join us in building the world's best gambling experience!


  
Occupational pension


Work-life balance


Personal trainer and gym facilities at the office


Wellness allowance


Free parking


Dog at the office


**Så här har vi det**  

Hos oss är du del av en innovativ miljö och med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar du den bästa spelupplevelsen. Vi gillar att samarbeta och hos oss får du stort utrymme att påverka ditt arbetssätt. Här hittar du nyfikna, nytänkande medarbetare och ledare – viktiga egenskaper för att kunna utveckla och utvecklas. Liksom energi , mod och motivation.


För att må bra är skrattmuskeln lika viktig att träna som alla andra muskler. Både den fysiska och den mentala hälsan skapar balans i livet. Hur vi har det på jobbet påverkar privatlivet- och vice versa. Vi ser det som en självklarhet att ge det stöd och de verktyg som behövs. Ditt val av arbetsplats och arbetssätt är flexibelt och vi lägger stor vikt på självledarskap.


Vi bryr oss om varandra och respekterar varandras olikheter på ATG. Och vi vill att våra kunder ska må bra och ha roligt när de spelar. Vi bryr oss också om sportens välmående, dvs. idrottarna och hästarna - och samhället runt omkring oss. Vi drivs inte av privata vinstintressen utan allt överskott går tillbaka till våra ägare, svensk trav- och galoppsport, något som både känns och gör gott.

title: Process Owner
description:
*I rollen som Process Owner kommer du att ha en ledande position i att säkerställa effektiva och kvalitetssäkrade processer för IT-utveckling samtidigt som du bidrar till vår agila transformation. Låter det spännande? Läs vidare!*  

**Om jobbet**
Som Process Owner kommer du att ansvara för att kontinuerligt övervaka och förbättra effektiviteten och efterlevnaden av våra processer inom IT-utveckling. Du kommer att spela en aktiv roll i att analysera, utvärdera och optimera processerna för att både öka effektiviteten och uppnå hög användarnöjdhet.  


Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter i denna roll är följande:  


* Identifiera, bedöma, hantera och minimera risker relaterade till processerna samt designa ändamålsenliga kontroller.
* Hantera brister och incidenter i processerna.
* Utveckla och följa upp KPIer för att mäta processernas effektivitet och kvalitet.
* Leda arbetet med att utveckla och effektivisera processerna tillsammans med verksamheten.
* Koordinera pilottester för effektivisering av verktygsstöd för IT-utveckling.
* Säkerställa att dokumentationskrav för processerna uppfylls enligt Länsförsäkringar AB-koncernens metod för processmodellering samt hålla dokumentation aktuell och tillgänglig.
* Säkerställa att styrande dokument och processbeskrivningar är korrekt relaterade till angränsande processer.

  


Rollen innebär att du samverkar med kollegor inom Effektiv systemutveckling, andra grupper inom Digital och IT samt affärsverksamheterna. Du har kontakter med användare av IT-processerna inom Länsförsäkringsgruppen och representerar processområdet inom Digital & ITs processforum. Du rapporterar till Chef för Effektiv systemutveckling.  


**Vem är du?**
För att trivas i rollen som Process Owner ser vi att du har gedigen erfarenhet av att ha jobbat med processer och att du har drivit projekt eller förändringsinitiativ. Vidare har du ett genuint intresse för att skapa effektivitet och kvalitet genom att driva förbättringsåtgärder. Du har god förmåga att kommunicera på både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.  


Det är meriterande om du har:
* Arbetat i verktyget Sparx EA och arbetat med Azure DevOps.
* Erfarenhet från bank/försäkringsbranschen.
* Erfarenhet av agila metoder.

  


Vi söker en kommunikativ person som är van vid att på ett effektivt sätt kommunicera med olika stakeholders med olika bakgrunder och språk. Du är driven och brinner för att kontinuerligt förbättra IT-processer och är alltid ute efter innovativa lösningar för att öka användarnöjdhet. Att driva verksamhetsutveckling och förändring i en komplex organisation är något du trivs med.  


**Om oss**
Vi välkomnar dig till avdelningen Gemensamma system och gruppen Effektiv systemutveckling. Gruppen består av cirka 30 medarbetare, inklusive Product Owners, DevOps Engineers och Lean Agila Coacher. Vi arbetar alla mot målet att möjliggöra hög digital kvalitet och effektiv IT-utveckling inom Länsförsäkringsgruppen, vilket säkerställer nöjda medarbetare och kunder.  

Gruppchef Charlotta Haldin fokuserar på att skapa rätt förutsättningar och en arbetsmiljö som möjliggör resultat och utveckling. Hon tror på öppenhet och individens förmåga att prestera och leverera värde tillsammans med andra. Ständigt lärande är hennes ledstjärna, och hon vet att innovation kräver mod och misslyckanden.  

Som grupp är vi engagerade, stolta över vår prestation och har roligt tillsammans. Vi eftersträvar en jämn fördelning mellan kön, ålder och etnicitet och välkomnar alla sökanden oavsett bakgrund.  


**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande?* *Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*  


**Sista ansökningsdag:** **2024-08-30**
Rekryteringensprocessen tar en paus under semestern och återkoppling gällande din ansökan väntas ske i augusti. Tack för ditt tålamod och vi önskar dig en trevlig sommar!
  
Kort om tjänsten


**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidare
**Arbetsplats:** Stockholm
**Chef:** Charlotta Haldin
**Kontaktuppgifter:** charlotta.haldin@lansforsakringar.se
Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?


Bli en del av något större och börja jobba hos oss. En karriär hos Länsförsäkringar handlar lika mycket om att vara en hjälpande hand för våra kunder genom alla livets skeenden som att stärka lokalsamhället där du verkar.
company_description: Vill du vara en del av lösningen, när livet förändras?

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**Om Frenda**
-------------


Frenda är ett svenskt produktbolag som utvecklar och levererar en heltäckande molnbaserad SaaS-lösning inom MedTech. Plattformen erbjuder en allt-i-ett lösning bestående av journalsystem, röntgen/bildbehandling samt lagring & säkerhetskopiering mot dentalbranschen.


Produkten är mycket uppskattad och är idag marknadsledande i Sverige. Med trygg investering, lönsamhet och en växande skara kunder är vi i en spännande fas för en fortsatt nationell, samt internationell expansion. Därmed söker vi nu fler utvecklare till tech-teamet som kommer att vara med och skala upp och anpassa plattformen mot nya kunder och marknader.

  

**Om Rollen**


Som Platform Engineer hos Frenda kommer du att spela en central roll i att hantera infrastrukturen och effektivisera leveransflödet från kod till produktion. Ditt huvudsakliga uppdrag blir att tillhandahålla en robust, säker och skalbar plattform, med fokus på att optimera och ge insikter i systemens prestanda och hälsa.

* **Design och utveckling:** Skapa en pålitlig och skalbar infrastruktur. Bygg och underhåll de grundläggande plattformarna som Frendas produkter körs på, säkerställa att de är skalbara, robusta och uppfyller höga kvalitetskrav.
* **CI/CD pipelines:** Utveckla och hantera integrations- och leveranspipelines som effektiviserar mjukvaruleveransen.
* **Övervakning och optimering:** Utveckla system för övervakning och tillhandahåll verktyg som hjälper produktteamen att förstå och förbättra systemens prestanda.
* **Samarbete med produktteam:** Arbeta nära produktteamen för att förstå deras behov och utmaningar. Säkerställ att plattformen uppfyller dessa behov och följer branschens bästa praxis.

**Teknikstack:** Azure, Octopus Deploy, TeamCity, C#, SQL och REST.


Vi jobbar i en hybrid-setup med möjlighet till flexibilitet att jobba från hemmet och kontoret.

### **Om dig**


Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att hantera och optimera utvecklingsmiljöer och leveranskedjor. För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har en bakgrund från att ha jobbat med plattformstjänster, developer experience eller DevOps.


Du har ett genuint intresse för systemutveckling och motiveras av att bygga verktyg och lösningar som underlättar för andra utvecklare. Du trivs med att leverera som ett team och har förmåga att arbeta effektivt mot flera produktteam.


**För att lyckas i rollen har du god erfarenhet av:**

* Designa, bygga och underhålla skalbara och robusta plattformar
* Hantera och optimera infrastruktur för hög tillgänglighet och prestanda
* Implementera och underhålla CI/CD pipelines
* Automatiseringstekniker och verktyg som Azure DevOps och Octopus Deploy
* Arbete med molninfrastruktur, speciellt Microsoft Azure.
* C# och SQL
* Skapa och underhålla RESTful APIs.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift

**Mer om Frenda**
-----------------


Frenda AB startades 2017 och består nu av omkring 55 medarbetare med huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm. Kulturen präglas av en familjär och öppen atmosfär med snabba beslutsprocesser. Hos Frenda värdesätter vi gemenskap och kontinuerlig utveckling, vi satsar på våra medarbetare och skapar möjligheter för var och en att växa och utvecklas inom bolaget.


Mer om erbjudandet

* Ta del av en spännande expansionsresa
* Flexibel arbetstid samt möjlighet till hybridarbete
* Schyssta förmåner, såsom generös friskvård, tjänstepension, sjukförsäkring och rabatterad lunch
* Möjlighet till kontinuerlig utveckling och samarbete med människor från flera olika bakgrunder

title: Arkitekt inom Edge & IoT på TechSeed
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för vassa kandidater.
  
För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.
  
TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt bolag som erbjuder konsulttjänster och har ett kompetensdjup inom flera domäner. Vi är på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu lösningsarkitekter som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt och tar ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans.
  
  

Som Lösningsarkitekt kommer du arbeta som konsult i samarbete med kund. TechSeed strävar efter att kunna erbjuda en blandning mellan placering hos kund och projekt som leds av TechSeed. Respektive uppdrag sätter förutsättningarna och det förväntas att du är bekväm med båda alternativen.
  
  

I den här rollen kommer du tillhöra enheten TechSeed Edge & IoT Göteborg, vars fokus sträcker sig från vision till leverans av uppkopplade system. IoT och IIoT handlar till stor del om att fånga datapunkter från verkligheten, en verklighet där kundernas utmaningar omfattar helt olika processer och verksamheter. Kanske är det du som sätter lösningsarkitekturen för fastighetsbolaget som önskar styra värme, vatten och ventilation mer hållbart. Kanske handlar ditt nästa uppdrag om att lösa insamling av mätdata i maritim miljö med utmaningar i såväl miljö, uppkoppling, underhåll och energiförsörjning. Edge syftar på bearbetning av data nära källan, vilket styrs av krav på säkerhet, bandbredd och underhåll. Som lösningsarkitekt ansvarar du för att fånga kundens krav, önskemål, möjligheter och utmaningar, samt såklart ta fram en lösningsarkitektur. Det förutsätter en teknisk bredd och ett nära samarbete med kund.
  
  

Som delägare och anställd kommer du vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen.
  
  

Vår grund ligger i att vi delar med oss av vår passion för teknik och värdet vi skapar. Det handlar bland annat om kunskapsutbyte och att dela idéer, bidra med god stämning såväl som att skapa värde genom vårt delägarskap. Vi erbjuder dig:
  
  

Inflytande i hur vi bygger TechSeed tillsammans
  
  

En öppen kultur där vi värdesätter olikheter, insikter och innovationer
  
  

Direkt värde från våra finansiella resultat genom bonus och delägarskap
  
  

Möjligheten att växa in i olika tekniska områden / ansvarsområden utifrån dina önskemål
  
  

Flexibelt arbete hemifrån, beroende på uppdragets behov.
  
  

Vem söker vi?
  
  

Vi söker dig vars expertis är lösningsarkitektur inom IoT / IIoT. Du förväntas ha bredd i dina tekniska kunskaper och god förståelse för hur tekniska lösningar, protokoll och plattformar bör kombineras för att möta kundernas behov. Några exempel på teknik och begrepp från vår vardag; AMQP, AWS/GCP/Azure IoT, Bluetooth, CoAP, DDS, DevOps, Digital Twin, HMI, IT/OT, Linux, LoRaWAN, LTE CAT, LwM2M, Machine Learning, MES, Modbus, MQTT, NB-IoT, ONNX / PyTorch / Cuda, OPC UA, PKI, PLC, PROFINET, SCADA, Sparkplug, Wi-Fi, ZigBee.
  
  

Om delar av ovan är en ingår i din vokabulär, verktygslåda och fångar ditt intresse - hör av dig!
  
  

Du är såklart nyfiken på ny teknik, trivs i roller där du utvecklas och i en kultur där vi hjälps åt och bygger bolaget tillsammans. Du har minst 5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet, är självklart lösningsorienterad och trivs i samarbete med kund. Eftersom vi arbetar med flera typer av kunder med olika behov kräver rollen att du kan uttrycka dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att jobba på ett start/scale-up, har tidigare konsulterfarenhet eller relevanta kunskaper från industrivertikaler och marknadsområden.
  
  

Om TechSeed
  
  

Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. Genom att erbjuda delägarskap till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen. Detta speglas både i vår kultur och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora tekniska intresse med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoret. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies och Smart Buildings.

title: DevOps Engineer (R-16371)
description:
Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet
  
Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,500+ global team members are passionate about what we do. We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers.
  
  

The candidate will be working in a small team focusing on devops.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Build, Improve and support CI/CD pipelines with a goal to maximize velocity, accuracy of deployments and faster deployment time
  
Improve DevOps process to mitigate production, performance, and operational problems and resolve issues as they occur
  
Collaborate closely with other members of the Devops, architects and development teams
  
Ensure configuration and compliance with analysis tools (for instance SonarQube)
  
Assist the Engineering team with OpenTelemetry based observability initiatives focused on self-service monitoring (Kibana/Grafana) and troubleshooting
  
Work with the security engineering team to ensure that security guardrails(Snyk) are implemented as early as possible in pipelines and resolve any infrastructure vulnerabilities.
  
Work collaboratively with software engineering to define infrastructure and deployment requirements
  
  

**Requirements:**  

DevOps Experience
  
AWS
  
Linux OS solid knowledge
  
Bash and Python scripting
  
Kubernetes
  
Docker
  
GitHub
  
English speaking
  
Should be ok with context-switching
  
  

**Nice to have:**  

SonarQube
  
Bamboo
  
Scrum/Kanban
  
Experience with database or cloud migration
  
General knowledge of programming languages to be able to figure things out when needed
  
Building and Running JVM based languages
  
Building and running NodeJS based languages
  
Location in Stockholm is a plus but not necessary
  
  

All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb. Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer

Vi drivs inte av privata vinstintressen utan allt överskott går tillbaka till våra ägare, svensk trav- och galoppsport, något som både känns och gör gott.

title: Creative technological co-founder - remote part-time
description:
We are looking for a technological co-founder for Modernera Technologies.
  
Modernera Technologies makes it easy to automate and share expertise.
  
We are creating a platform where experts can create expert systems without knowledge of programming. These systems can provide automatic advice to the end-user through a series of questions and answers in the form of interactive decision trees. Our platform can be used in a broad range of fields like law, medicine, customer service, and so on.
  
We are targeting the market for automation, it is a fast-growing market as organizations globally leverage automation to increase value. Automation leads to increased flexibility, improved quality, increased savings, and productivity.
  
Our solution is hosted on Microsoft Azure. We use Azure DevOps to plan our sprints and collaborate. We implement continuous integration and continuous delivery. We work with Angular on the frontend and ASP.NET Core on the backend.
  
A public beta version of the system has been released. You are welcome to try it out at www.modernera.com! Our software has been used at the law program at Stockholm University to educate law students about how to build systems for automatic legal advice. We have some early users of the product and are on our way to getting pilot projects with bigger organizations.
  
We are looking for a technological co-founder to take our product to the next level. You are passionate about software development and want to make a real impact with your work.
  
As the company grows you will take over responsibility for managing the development process and a team of developers.
  
  

**What we offer:**  

* Influence - as a co-founder you will become a key member of the team with big opportunities to influence the future of the company.
* Incentives - you will get the opportunity to acquire shares in the company.
* Flexibility- the opportunity to work when and where you want. There is also the opportunity to work anywhere from 30 – 100 % depending on your availability.
* Experience – you will get invaluable experience from working with all the aspects of a startup.


Be a part of a thriving startup community
  
* Business Development Coach from KTH
* Access to mentor and investor network
* Proof-of-concept funding
* Centrally located office space (KTH Campus)
* Be part of the thriving KTH Innovation Community
* Workshops and service packs from KTH partners
* Access to Media Studio and Makerspace


SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS
  
* We are flexible in regards to your previous experience if you believe that you have what it takes to do the job and are willing to learn. We believe in diversity and inclusion and therefore welcome all applicants regardless of gender, background and beliefs.
* It is beneficial if you have good knowledge of Angular, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SQL, C# and ASP.NET Core.
* Fluency in English and preferably also in Swedish
* It is beneficial if you have experience with Microsoft Azure, DevOps, TDD and ML.


ABOUT THE COMPANY
  
Modernera Technologies is a startup in the KTH Innovation pre-incubator program. We also collaborate with The Swedish Law and Informatics Research Institute. We are developing a platform that makes it easy to automate and share expertise. Our vision is to transform the way knowledge is shared and to make expertise more easily available.
  
Apply by sending your CV and cover letter to info@modernera.se. Write "Creative technological co-founder - remote part-time" in the subject line.

title: CI/CD Platform Engineer
description:
**Job Description**  

We are looking for a CI/CD Platform Engineer to be part of the Platform Applications team. Product teams in H&M are diverse and span from team developing internal services to those targeting a global customer base of millions. The Platform Applications team specializes in providing tooling, software templates, and solutions to accelerate product teams to deliver value.


You should have a continuous improvement mindset seeking to automate and remove cognitive load for our consumers, understanding the use case for CI/CD.


You need to be able to use build tools and understand how build tools are used in CI and worked with implementation and maintenance of automated infrastructure solutions.


You also need to be able to move around like a fish with containers and deploying to containerized cloud components. Other important things include researching different deployment strategies, CI/CD pipeline optimization. Having worked with development of applications in the past is a must, and more than anything you need to be passionate about CI/CD automation.


As a key player within the Platform Applications team, some of your responsibilities will include:

* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain software templates, assets, and workflows incorporating best technology practices.
* Driving the standardization and reusability of code and components across the organization, aiming to decrease the cognitive load on developers.
* Contributing to the continuous improvement of the developer experience in the full software development lifecycle by identifying pain points, streamlining processes, and implementing innovative solutions.

  

**Qualifications**  

Experience with DevOps practices and Platform Engineering especially focusing on developing and maintaining efficient Software Development Lifecycle automation templates.


These are the tools/technologies we are using on a daily basis:

* GitHub and GitHub actions
* GIT
* Terraform
* Azure
* Kubernetes
* Helm
* Docker
* At least one programming language.

  

**Additional Information**  

This is a full-time permanent position, starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.


Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible, but no later than the 15th of July 2024. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page. If you have any questions about the role, please contact responsible recruiter Devika Langar at devika.langar@hm.com

**Benefits**  

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*

**Inclusion & Diversity**  

H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence, all diversity dimensions are considered in our recruitment process.

**Company Description**


H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here. #LI-T1

title: Product Owner - Information Security
description:
We are Zeekr Technology Europe. Powered by engineers and creative minds from all over the world. Located in Gothenburg, Sweden, one of the leading mobility innovation grounds worldwide. Established in 2013 as CEVT and began with the mission to create a revolutionary modular vehicle architecture, CMA. As of 2024, CEVT is now Zeekr Technology Europe, signaling our belonging within Zeekr. Delivering intelligent, sustainable, and user centric technology and software for tomorrow's electric mobility today.
  
About This Opportunity
  
As a Product Owner for Information security, you will join the Enterprise Digital department within Digital Development & Operations (DDO). We are on a journey, together as a global team, establishing ZEEKR in Europe and Globally with digital capabilities. The overall DDO vision is to be an innovator, a transformative leader, and an enabler for reaching our business objectives.
  
The area of Enterprise digital consists of several product areas which are: Collaboration, Big data, Cloud & DevOps, Enterprise architecture, PMO, Information security, and Service portfolio. As a product owner, you will lead one of the areas and the teams within.
  
  

**Information security consists of below key areas:**  

Information security – ISO27001 & NSIT
  
Business continuity
  
Risk management
  
SOX compliance
  
Security operations center
  
Enterprise architecture
  
Privacy architecture
  
  

What You Will DoThe product owner is responsible for identifying the customer needs and the larger business objectives that a product, feature, or area will fulfill, articulates what success looks like for a product, and rallies a team to turn that vision into a reality.
  
Lead and manage teams consisting of professionals; provide guidance, mentorship and ensure motivated and high-performing teams.
  
Define & develop the vision and strategy for the product area in line with business objectives.
  
Conduct market research to understand business needs, industry trends, and competitive landscapes.
  
Define performance indicators to measure the success of the area and to enable data-driven decision-making and continuous improvements.
  
Create and maintain a product roadmap that outlines the planned features and enhancements over time.
  
Prioritize features based on business value, customer impact, and resource constraints.
  
Ensure close cross-collaboration between enabling teams from different product areas globally.
  
Clearly define and document product requirements, ensuring that the team understands the goals and objectives.
  
Engage with key stakeholders, including executives, business teams, and internal IT teams, to gather input and build support for the product.
  
Maintain a deep understanding of the business needs and pain points.
  
  

You will bringWe expect you to be the kind of person that thrives in an environment where not everything is set and a solution needs to be defined, prototyped, and implemented with emphasis on automation, speed, and reliability. We believe that a DevOps approach and culture will be the key to success in the collaboration. We see that you have:
  
Strong leadership skills to guide and motivate a team of professionals with the ability to delegate tasks, set goals, and provide feedback and support.
  
Experience working as a product manager or product owner within Digital/IT areas.
  
Proven experience from leading information security or secops areas.
  
In-depth knowledge of ISO27001 and NIST frameworks.
  
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  
Holistic view and capability to understand IT Services in a business context.
  
Knowledge of DevOps culture, Agile processes, and principles.
  
A team mindset and an outgoing personality with the ability to guide and inspire others. The team is located in Gothenburg, Lindholmen but works with teams and stakeholders all over the world.
  
  

Why you should join Zeekr TechnologyEuropeWe are engineers, developers, and innovators from around the world. Joined together by entrepreneurship, our unique blend of global culture, and a belief in a smarter more sustainable future. At Zeekr Technology Europewe fast-track innovation and transform ideas into pioneering technology solutions, doing your master thesis here is no different. We are convinced that a thesis project is a major contribution to our innovation capabilities and long-term development. You'll have a great opportunity to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of whats possible.What Happens When You ApplyIf this sounds interesting and you match the requirements, please don't hesitate to submit your application with a CV and cover letter. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview to further discuss the project's details and expectations.
  
**Last application date:** 2024-08-18Do you want to join us on our journey? Welcome, to contact us for more informationValjon Hasani, Head of Enterprise Digital, valjon.hasani@cevt.se for questions regarding the positionKristina Larsson Djokovic, Senior Recruiter, kristina.larsson@cevt.se forquestions regarding the recruitment process
  
Please note that due to GDPR,we can only accept applications and CVs sent through the recruitment system, not via email or other channels.
  
Working at Zeekr Technology Europe
  
More than 900 researchers and engineers in Gothenburg, Sweden. Delivering intelligent, sustainable, and user centric technology and software for tomorrow's electric mobility today. We thrive on speed, innovation, and collaboration. We aim to adapt and lead change. Join our vibrant team now.
  
Supportive and creative work environment
  
30 days of vacation and additional 8 days paid ATK- days annually
  
Annual STI program to reward your performance
  
Flexible workplace with possibility to work from home 2 days a week
  
  

#LI-KLD

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**Om Frenda**
-------------


Frenda är ett svenskt produktbolag som utvecklar och levererar en heltäckande molnbaserad SaaS-lösning inom MedTech. Plattformen erbjuder en allt-i-ett lösning bestående av journalsystem, röntgen/bildbehandling samt lagring & säkerhetskopiering mot dentalbranschen.


Produkten är mycket uppskattad och är idag marknadsledande i Sverige. Med trygg investering, lönsamhet och en växande skara kunder är vi i en spännande fas för en fortsatt nationell, samt internationell expansion. Därmed söker vi nu fler utvecklare till tech-teamet som kommer att vara med och skala upp och anpassa plattformen mot nya kunder och marknader.

  

**Om Rollen**


Som Platform Engineer hos Frenda kommer du att spela en central roll i att hantera infrastrukturen och effektivisera leveransflödet från kod till produktion. Ditt huvudsakliga uppdrag blir att tillhandahålla en robust, säker och skalbar plattform, med fokus på att optimera och ge insikter i systemens prestanda och hälsa.

* **Design och utveckling:** Skapa en pålitlig och skalbar infrastruktur. Bygg och underhåll de grundläggande plattformarna som Frendas produkter körs på, säkerställa att de är skalbara, robusta och uppfyller höga kvalitetskrav.
* **CI/CD pipelines:** Utveckla och hantera integrations- och leveranspipelines som effektiviserar mjukvaruleveransen.
* **Övervakning och optimering:** Utveckla system för övervakning och tillhandahåll verktyg som hjälper produktteamen att förstå och förbättra systemens prestanda.
* **Samarbete med produktteam:** Arbeta nära produktteamen för att förstå deras behov och utmaningar. Säkerställ att plattformen uppfyller dessa behov och följer branschens bästa praxis.

**Teknikstack:** Azure, Octopus Deploy, TeamCity, C#, SQL och REST.


Vi jobbar i en hybrid-setup med möjlighet till flexibilitet att jobba från hemmet och kontoret.

### **Om dig**


Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att hantera och optimera utvecklingsmiljöer och leveranskedjor. För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har en bakgrund från att ha jobbat med plattformstjänster, developer experience eller DevOps.


Du har ett genuint intresse för systemutveckling och motiveras av att bygga verktyg och lösningar som underlättar för andra utvecklare. Du trivs med att leverera som ett team och har förmåga att arbeta effektivt mot flera produktteam.


**För att lyckas i rollen har du god erfarenhet av:**

* Designa, bygga och underhålla skalbara och robusta plattformar
* Hantera och optimera infrastruktur för hög tillgänglighet och prestanda
* Implementera och underhålla CI/CD pipelines
* Automatiseringstekniker och verktyg som Azure DevOps och Octopus Deploy
* Arbete med molninfrastruktur, speciellt Microsoft Azure.
* C# och SQL
* Skapa och underhålla RESTful APIs.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift

**Mer om Frenda**
-----------------


Frenda AB startades 2017 och består nu av omkring 55 medarbetare med huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm. Kulturen präglas av en familjär och öppen atmosfär med snabba beslutsprocesser. Hos Frenda värdesätter vi gemenskap och kontinuerlig utveckling, vi satsar på våra medarbetare och skapar möjligheter för var och en att växa och utvecklas inom bolaget.


Mer om erbjudandet

* Ta del av en spännande expansionsresa
* Flexibel arbetstid samt möjlighet till hybridarbete
* Schyssta förmåner, såsom generös friskvård, tjänstepension, sjukförsäkring och rabatterad lunch
* Möjlighet till kontinuerlig utveckling och samarbete med människor från flera olika bakgrunder
