title: AI Solutions Consultant, GFI Software (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, GFI Software. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Are you ready to step into the future of sales and channel management? The channel management industry often grapples with inefficiencies in scaling operations, maintaining consistent growth, and effectively integrating technology to enhance partner interactions. Many companies still rely on traditional methods that lack data-driven decision-making and advanced analytical capabilities.
   

  

 At GFI, we revolutionize this space by integrating Generative AI across all facets of our channel management processes. Our cutting-edge approach not only optimizes operations but also drives sustained revenue growth by enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of our network of distributors, resellers, and MSPs. This is an electrifying opportunity to be at the forefront of tech-driven sales innovation, leveraging AI to transform standard practices into dynamic, strategic engagements that deliver measurable results.
   

  

 This role is not your typical channel sales role. You will be expected to master and deploy Generative AI tools, ensuring our partnerships are not just maintained but also optimized and expanded through strategic data-driven methodologies. Your work will involve rigorous partner recruitment, dynamic training sessions, and stringent performance assessments—all enhanced by advanced AI.
   

  

 You'll fit into a team of forward-thinkers where each member is crucial in sculpting the future landscape of channel sales. Your role is pivotal in shaping how partnerships flourish in a tech-driven environment, ensuring both the growth of GFI and our partners. If you are eager to redefine industry standards and possess a robust blend of GenerativeAI proficiency, professional communication, and channel sales management, we encourage you to apply. Join us in transforming the blueprint of channel management and take your place as a leader in a cutting-edge sales revolution.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Partner Recruitment and Onboarding: Identifying, recruiting, and onboarding new partners to expand the channel network. This involves evaluating potential partners' alignment with the company's values and goals, as well as their market reach and capabilities.
* Training and Development: Providing partners with the necessary training and resources to effectively sell and support the product. This includes product training, sales techniques, and ongoing professional development to enhance their capabilities.
* Performance Monitoring and Management: Continuously monitoring the performance of partners against predefined benchmarks and metrics. This includes regular assessment of sales figures, customer feedback, and other performance indicators to identify areas for improvement.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Directly selling to end-user customers
* Prioritizing the quantity of interactions over the quality of your engagements with partners
* Worrying about unpredictable earnings and relentless travel demands


**AI Solutions Consultant Key Responsibilities**
* Sustained revenue growth from efficiently managing and optimizing a network of distributors, resellers, and MSPs using GenerativeAI tools


**Basic Requirements**
* Professional experience leveraging multiple LLMs (ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, etc.) and AI tools to automate manual tasks and boost your company's productivity (if you've only ever used ChatGPT, that's probably not enough)
* 1+ year of indirect channel sales experience in the software industry (direct sales experience does not count)


**About GFI Software**
 GFI Software develops essential applications for small and medium businesses. Over 80,000 customers choose GFI solutions for network management and performance, security, and collaboration applications. GFI Software available through thousands of channel partners dedicated to serving specific countries and regions worldwide.
   

  

 GFI has a fully remote, global workforce. GFI has partnered with Crossover to administer its hiring and global workforce management.

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

title: Executive Assistant to worlds largest search engine company
description:
We are seeking an experienced Executive Assistant to provide dedicated support to two Directors within our Cloud division. One director oversees Cloud operations across the Nordics, while the other focuses specifically on the Sweden Cloud segment. This role is pivotal in bridging leadership and the Cloud Nordics team, ensuring seamless operations and communication.
   

  

**About the Role:** 
 As an Executive Assistant, you will manage a variety of administrative tasks and program management activities to support our top executives and their teams. You will be part of a dynamic and diverse work environment with flexible working hours and locations. Reporting directly to senior executives, your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

  

* Calendar Management: Schedule, maintain, and update calendar events for the executives with minimal guidance. This is a significant part of the role, requiring 60-70% of your time.
* Travel Management: Coordinate travel for executives and their teams, including visa and passport support and pre-travel preparations.
* Expense Reporting: Perform expense management tasks, including completing and reviewing expense reports and purchase orders.
* Meeting Coordination: Prepare meetings, ensuring all details are in place and creating meeting materials.
* Partner Collaboration: Partner with other Executive Assistants for meeting and event planning.
* Proactive Support: Anticipate the needs of the directors and act one step ahead to ensure smooth operations.


**About You:** 
 We are looking for someone with previous experience in similar administrative roles, ideally in a sales or high-tech environment. You should have:
   

  

  

* 5+ years of experience supporting multiple executives simultaneously.
* Proven experience in calendar management.
* Strong understanding of expense processing and approval procedures.
* Ability to manage confidential information with discretion.
* Experience in meeting coordination and setting agendas.
* Excellent relationship-building skills and a proactive approach.
* Proficiency in travel management and planning.
* Strong English language skills; English fluency is crucial for this role.


**About The Client**
 The client is renowned as the world’s largest search engine company, leading the industry with innovative products and services that enhance user experience globally.
   

  

**Contact Information** 
 If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, feel free to contact the responsible recruiter via jesper.jenefjard@adecco.se
   

  

 For questions regarding registration, please contact support at info@adecco.se
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Keywords** 
 Administrator, Executive Assistant, Program Manager, Search Engine Industry, Event Planning, Expense Management, Travel Coordination, Calendar Management, Confidentiality, Adecco

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to a provider of complete and sustainable transport solutions. As part of this journey, we are seeking an experienced Senior Software Developer to join our Autonomous Asset Data team. This role offers a unique opportunity to lead in utilizing operational data to create valuable insights, facilitating advanced analytics, and enhancing collaborative decision-making within Scania Autonomous.
   

  

**Your Role:**
 As a Senior Software Developer, you will architect and lead the development of advanced data pipelines that process rapid sensor streams, leverage optimal data storage solutions, and create robust APIs. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

  

* Designing and implementing high-quality software using modern tools and frameworks.
* Developing a new logging solution tailored for substantial Big Data volumes and Machine Learning applications.
* Managing and processing PB+ scale data from diverse sources such as Cameras, Lidars, and Radars.
* Guiding internal research teams in adopting the latest Big Data and machine learning technologies.


**Team Dynamics:**
 You will work with a diverse group of experts from various cultures and backgrounds, including Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers. The team focuses on centralizing data while decentralizing its application, covering all aspects from requirements gathering to production and maintenance. We employ agile methodologies and are deeply committed to innovation and excellence in autonomous transport solutions.
   

  

**What You Bring:**
* At least ten years of experience in software development with a significant track record in large-scale projects.
* At least five years in Cloud environments specializing in Big Data.
* Expertise in Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Agile methodologies, Test-Driven Development, and Infrastructure as Code.
* Advanced knowledge of Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka.
* Strong leadership qualities with the ability to mentor and guide teams.
* A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
* Excellent proficiency in English, both written and spoken.
* AWS or similar certifications would be highly regarded.


**Why Scania?**
 Scania offers a healthy, inspiring workplace that respects individual needs and promotes both personal and professional growth. We provide significant opportunities for leadership and development. Our comprehensive benefits package includes performance bonuses, an occupational pension, flexible working arrangements, subsidized meals, and more. In Stockholm, benefit from our direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Job Express, and access to our Stockholm City office, Scania Sergel.
   

  

**Join Us:**
 If you are driven by innovation and leadership in technology and seek a role where your efforts will make a measurable impact, please apply with your cover letter, CV, and copies of your graduation diploma/certificate by the 30th of june. For more information, contact Joel Wohlstedt, recruiting manager, at joel.wohlstedt@scania.com.
   

  

 Get some insights of which you will be a part of:
   

  

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l34sreA2Mjo
   

  

 Explore the future of autonomous development with us and be a part of making history in sustainable transport solutions.

title: Forward Deployed Software Engineer
description:
**A World-Changing Company**
 Palantir builds the world’s leading software for data-driven decisions and operations. By bringing the right data to the people who need it, our platforms empower our partners to develop lifesaving drugs, forecast supply chain disruptions, locate missing children, and more.
   

  

**The Role**
 Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) work directly with customers to quickly understand their greatest problems and design and implement solutions to use data against them. Our customers rely on Palantir’s platforms for some of their most critical operations, and projects often start with an open ended question like “Why are we delaying so many flights?” or “How can we better identify instances of money laundering?” As an FDSE, you’ll apply your problem solving ability, creativity, and technical skills to help organizations use their data to drive a real impact in the world. You’ll have the opportunity to gain rare insight into and contribute to some of the world’s most important industries and institutions.
   

  

 As an FDSE your responsibilities look similar to those of a startup CTO: you’ll work in small teams with minimal supervision and own end-to-end execution of high stakes projects. Your day might span discussing architecture with fellow engineers, wrangling massive-scale data, coding a custom web app, speaking with customer executives, or establishing strategy for your team.
   

  

 Whether you aspire to be an entrepreneur or an engineering leader, we believe Palantir is the best place — with the best colleagues — to learn how. You’ll learn how to unpack a problem and understand the costs and consequences of its solution. You’ll learn new technologies and languages, and even develop them yourself. You’ll work autonomously and make decisions independently, within a community that will support and challenge you as you grow and develop.
   

  

**Our Principles**
* Impact: We take on meaningful and challenging projects that change the world for the better.
* Ownership: We see projects through from beginning to end, working through any obstacles we may encounter.
* Collaboration: We work internally with people from a variety of backgrounds — such as other FDSEs, product teams, and Deployment Strategists. We also work externally with our customers, often on-site, to understand and solve their problems.
* Trust: We trust each other to effectively manage time and priorities and give people the space to think for themselves.
* Growth: We encourage ourselves and our peers to seek new challenges and opportunities for growth, as well as find new ways to innovate and share knowledge.
* Learning: We often face entirely novel problems where we need to pick up a lot of new knowledge and learn how to use it to make progress. We believe experiential learning is one of the best teachers.


**What We Value**
* A highly analytical mindset and eagerness to solve technical problems with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
* Experience or interest in working with and using large scale data to solve valuable business problems.
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals, and comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.
* Ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision.


**What We Require**
* 1+ years of relevant, post-college work experience.
* Strong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics, and Data Science.
* Strong coder with shown proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, C++, TypeScript/JavaScript, or similar.
* Ability and interest to travel up to 25%, as needed to client sites, but flexible based on personal preferences.
* Security clearance or the ability to obtain a clearance.
* Swedish language fluency.


**Life at Palantir**
 We want every Palantirian to achieve their best outcomes, that’s why we celebrate individuals’ strengths, skills, and interests, from your first interview to your longterm growth, rather than rely on traditional career ladders. Paying attention to the needs of our community enables us to optimize our opportunities to grow and helps ensure many pathways to success at Palantir. Promoting health and well-being across all areas of Palantirians’ lives is just one of the ways we’re investing in our community. Learn more at Life at Palantir and note that our offerings may vary by region.
   

  

 In keeping consistent with Palantir’s values and culture, we believe employees are “better together” and in-person work affords the opportunity for more creative outcomes. Therefore, we encourage employees to work from our offices to foster connectivity and innovation. Many teams do offer hybrid options (WFH a day or two a week), allowing our employees to strike the right trade-off for their personal productivity. Based on business need, there are a few roles that allow for “Remote” work on an exceptional basis. If you are applying for one of these roles, you must work from the city and or country in which you are employed. If the posting is specified as Onsite, you are required to work from an office.
   

  

*Palantir is committed to promoting a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe that all Palantirians share the responsibility of upholding our commitment to these values and encourage candidates from a wide range of backgrounds, perspectives, and lived experiences to join us in solving the world’s hardest problems.*
*Palantir is committed to making the job application process accessible to everyone. If you are living with a disability (visible or not visible) and need to request a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, please reach out and let us know how we can help.*

The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-4649-SE-Stockhol-SeniorProductM

title: Software Developer
description:
Are you ready to be at the forefront of shaping the energy infrastructure for the future?
 



  





 Our society is undergoing a significant green industrial revolution. To keep pace with the rate of electrification and renewable energy expansion we need to be installing 10 MW of Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) every other week until 2030. Multiply that figure by 10 when considering wider Europe.
 



  





 At Stella Futura, we aim to address these challenges and ensure energy supply for the future. We achieve this by designing, owning, and operating BESS facilities across the Nordics. Rooted in engineering expertise, focusing on financial innovation and flexible commercial solutions, we pioneer new modern energy infrastructure across the region.
 



  





**About the Role:** 



* Design, develop, and maintain software solutions and integrations including data flow, analysis and security.
* Work closely with our team of system engineers, market intelligence, business developers and other stakeholders to gather, interpret and decipher requirements to define software specifications.
* Ensure the optimisation of software performance, scalability, and reliability.
* Coordinate activities between internal and external resources managing relationships and communication between various stakeholders.
* Plan and execute software testing and piloting programmes.
* Create and maintain technical documentation for software applications.



  





**Who We're Seeking:** 



* MSc degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electronic/Electrical Engineering, a related field or equivalent experience.
* Experience of running software development projects.
* >4 years of experience in a similar role.
* Proficiency in relevant programming languages and data analysis and visualisation tools (e.g. Python, C++, Pandas, Tableau)
* Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and IoT technologies.
* Knowledge of energy and/or battery systems and green energy infrastructure is of merit.
* Good verbal and written command of English is essential. Proficiency in Swedish is of merit.



  





**To Succeed in This Role:** 




 We're looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and can effectively carry out multifaceted projects. Your strategic mindset, coupled with a strong work ethic and attention to detail, will be key to driving project success. We value qualities like curiosity, adaptability, accountability, decisiveness, and a commitment to continuous improvement and knowledge sharing. As an essential member of our team, we expect you to demonstrate leadership potential and take initiative in driving both your own professional growth and the development of our company.
 



  





**What we offer:** 



* A unique growth journey with the opportunity to shape our future energy infrastructure.
* An annual training budget and certification support.
* The chance to work with innovative technologies on exciting projects.
* An international workplace characterised by entrepreneurship and team spirit, where we support each other to succeed and advance towards a more sustainable future.



  





 Ready to make a difference? Apply now to join our team and be part of shaping the future of energy.
 



  





**About Stella Futura:** 




 Stella Futura is technology-independent and offers market-leading sustainable energy solutions that include both battery systems and solar installations. Our customers include industries, public institutions, and commercial properties. A key aspect is to offer business setups and financing solutions with financial partners that make it possible for customers to purchase the energy solution as a service, without heavy initial investments. By combining deep engineering expertise with new financing solutions, Stella Futura creates the conditions for a rapid green transition for its customers. The company operates in Sweden. It is owned by the founders and Profura. The headquarters is centrally located in Gamla stan, Stockholm.
 



  





 Want to know more about us? Listen to our podcast here. Learn more about the benefits of our battery systems here.

title: Linux Server Software Engineering Manager
description:
The Partner Engineering team works with the leading silicon companies to optimise Ubuntu to get the most from each new chip. Our goal is to collaborate with specialist engineers from our partners to integrate next-generation features and performance enhancements for upcoming hardware, while also ensure a common operating experience for their users.
   

  

 This role is a fast-paced, problem-solving role that's challenging yet very exciting. The right candidate must be resourceful, articulate, and able to deliver on a wide variety of solutions across server and data center technologies.
   

  

 As a Partner Engineering Manager at Canonical you will lead an engineering team that works across the full Linux server stack from kernel to AI workloads, to optimise Ubuntu for the latest silicon. You will manage relationships with our key technology partners by ensuring timely delivery on agreed project milestones.
   

  

 As a lead for strong engineers, technical leadership and a solid background in software engineering is a must, so that you're able to challenge and grow your team members. Code reviews and architectural leadership are part of the job. As manager, the commitment to healthy engineering practices, documentation, quality and performance optimisation are equally important technical responsibilities, as is the requirement for fair and clear management, and the obligation to ensure a high performing team. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

**Location:** 
*This is a Globally remote role*
 What your day will look like
   

  

* Lead a team of distributed engineers to design and implement the best Ubuntu integration for the latest server-class hardware platforms and software stacks
* Engage with commercial partners to deliver a delightful, optimised, first class Ubuntu experience on their platforms
* Develop your team through coaching, mentoring, leading by example, and feedback
* Oversee commercial engagements and support timely delivery on agreed project milestones
* Ensure an ongoing commitment to strict quality and reliability standards
* Engage with other teams at Canonical to ensure alignment on product architecture and roadmaps
* Work from home with global travel up to twice a year for up to two weeks


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Proven track record in technical roles with Linux, preferably Ubuntu or Debian
* High quality software engineering with in-depth knowledge of C/C++ and Python
* Experience with one or more of: Ubuntu - kernel and userspace, deb/snap packaging, embedded linux, QEMU/KVM and/or OVS/OVN
* Experience working directly with customers, going beyond resolving their technical issues, to interpreting their business challenges and effectively communicating how your solution will meet their needs
* Experience managing software engineers with a track record of planning, delivery and quality
* Effective collaboration across multiple internal teams, building trust and delivering results


 What we offer you
   

  

 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Kontorschef/ delägare till Effektiv Stockholm
description:
*Är du en affärsorienterad ledare som älskar att driva team till framgång? Är du intresserad av delägarskap? Vill du vara med och skala upp vår verksamhet? Då kan du vara precis den vi söker som vår nästa kontorschef på vårt kontor i Stockholm.* 




  





**DIN FRAMTIDA ARBETSGIVARE** 




 Effektiv är det personliga kompetensföretaget med tjänster som rekrytering, bemanning, verksamhetsutveckling, coachning, matchning och human tech. Inom vår koncern finns också techbolaget iPool – ditt Workforce Management (WFM) SaaS som årligen bemannar mer än 1 000 000 arbetspass på över 1 700 arbetsplatser.
 



  





 Effektiv består av 11 bolag och omsätter cirka 400 miljoner kr. Vi är en innovativ och snabbrörlig koncern där innovation och digitalisering är både vår nutid och framtid. Effektiv har blivit utsedd till Årets Karriärföretag för femte året i rad och nyligen korade till Årets Rekryteringsföretag i Sverige av Recruitment Awards.
 



  





 Vi på Effektiv är lagspelare som vill ta GULD varje dag tillsammans. Kultur, värderingar och gemenskap är viktiga nycklar till vår framgång. Vi vill ge tillbaka till samhället och stöttar över 170 lokala föreningar i hela Sverige. Läs mer om Effektiv och vårt samhällsengagemang på effektiv.se.
 



  





 Effektiv Stockholms kontor finner du centralt på Olof Palmes Gata 11.
 



  





**VAD ERBJUDER ROLLEN?** 




 Som kontorschef får du möjlighet att driva ditt bolags framgångsresa och tillväxt tillsammans med ett litet men fantastiskt team. Du har en roll som är både operativ och strategisk och ansvarar för försäljning, personal, kunder, leverans och affärsutveckling.
 



  





 Detta innebär att du:
 


* Aktivt identifierar och bearbetar nya affärsmöjligheter på marknaden
* Leder och utvecklar personal och kunder i linje med våra värderingar
* Kvalitetssäkrar att kontoret följer lagar, regler och arbetar med god kvalitet
* Arbetar operativt med rekrytering och/eller bemanning



  





 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden inkluderar:
 


* Driva affärsutvecklingen och ansvara för bolagets resultatutveckling
* Ta ett helhetsansvar för rekryteringsprocesser, från analys till avslut och uppföljning
* Delta aktivt i branschnätverk och evenemang för att stärka Effektivs närvaro och engagemang lokalt och regionalt
* Aktivt bidra i forum inom koncernen och delta i utvecklingen av Effektiv



  





 Beroende på möjligheter och intresse finns det även utrymme att diskutera ett upplägg med delägarskap i bolaget.
 



  





**VEM ÄR DU?** 




 Du är en passionerad och målinriktad ledare med gedigen erfarenhet inom rekrytering och bemanning. Du är van att navigera i en snabbrörlig kontext och att bidra till teamets insats. Du ser dig som affärssinnad men också värderingsstyrd med "hjärtat på rätt ställe", något som du tar med dig in i ditt ledarskap.
 



  





 För att lyckas i rollen har du tidigare arbetat inom branschen i en ledande befattning (kontorschef, gruppchef, affärsområdeschef eller liknande) med både personal- och resultatansvar. Du känner väl till bemannings- och rekryteringsaffären ”från ax till limpa” och har själv arbetat med leverans. Du är van vid att ta helhetsansvar för både större och mindre kunder, och du är trygg i att förhandla prisvillkor och säkerställa leverans utifrån avtal.
 



  





 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi det som viktigt att du har ett upparbetat lokalt nätverk och känner till marknaden i Stockholm med omnejd. Givetvis är du strukturerad och organiserad, vilket gör att du effektivt hanterar administrativa detaljer och upprätthåller ordning i komplexa projekt. Du är van att arbeta i affärssystem och andra digitala miljöer och har en nyfikenhet och driv för att nyttja digitala verktyg för att bli mer effektiv.
 



  





 För denna roll ser vi att du har akademisk utbildning inom relevant område eller motsvarande relevant erfarenhet. B-körkort är ett krav, och det är meriterande om du är certifierad och har arbetat med personbedömningsverktyg.
 



  





**ÄR DETTA DIN PERFEKTA MATCH?** 




 Vi erbjuder dig en ansvarsfull nyckelroll i en organisation som siktar högt, där alla är involverade och engagerade. Som kontorschef finns det goda möjligheter att påverka och se tydliga resultat på dina insatser i ett dynamiskt företag med korta beslutsvägar och engagerade ägare. Välkommen till ett bolag där laget står i centrum och där du får chansen att ta bolaget till en ny nivå – alltid med innovation som ledord!
 



  





**OM TEAM EFFEKTIV** 




 Vi är stolta över vår interna struktur med dedikerade bolag över olika orter. I rollen som kontorschef får du stöd av Effektivs centrala funktioner som stärker varje bolag genom samordning av gemensamma resurser och expertis, vilket ger det bästa av både lokalt engagemang och central styrka. Du blir en del av ett företag som värderar personalens kompetens och arrangerar roliga aktiviteter, med ett stort samhällsengagemang. Vi lever våra värdeord varje dag: Glada, Utforskande, Långsiktiga och Driftiga (GULD!) – vi hoppas att du delar dessa med oss.
 



  





**VARMT VÄLKOMMEN MED DIN ANSÖKAN** 




 Låter tjänsten intressant? Välkommen med din ansökan via effektiv.se. Sista ansökningsdatum är 14 augusti 2024. Vi kommer primärt att kalla till intervju efter sista ansökningsdatum, men är du intresserad och vill veta mer om tjänsten, kontakta gärna Mathias Svensson på mathias@effektiv.se, eller Kristina Halovanic på kristina@effektiv.se.

title: Kontoansvarig
description:
**Senior Account Executive – Governance, Risk Compliance & Sustainability GRC-S** 




  





**Be a part of a fast-growing company with enabling client potential.** 




 Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment, where you gain great responsibility and an opportunity to contribute to a journey of growth? Do you want to become a part of a talented, high-performance team, who are contributing to the goal of high double-digit growth this year?
 



 If yes, you might be our new Senior Account Executive and team-member in our office in Stockholm where you get to combine your sales and technical skills.
 



  





**About RISMA – are you ready to join a growth journey?** 




 RISMA is a Danish founded SaaS company within the GRC- and sustainability field (Governance, Risk, and Compliance) and a Nordic market leader whose purpose is to empower good corporate citizenship with a platform that helps organizations to be in control and make the correct decisions.
 



 RISMA has proven our value and position in the market and grown from a startup in 2014 and taken the next step as a scale up company where we were listed on Nasdaq in March 2021.
 *We are +50 employees and have around 600 clients and have grown around 50% in 2022 and 2023.* 




 The market for GRC-S solution platforms is on an exciting journey, launching into an unmatured market with an extensive growth potential. RISMA is therefore expanding and looking for an a
 



 dynamic and results-driven solution Sales Representative with experience in the GRC-S market to join our growing team.
 



 The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success in software sales, with a deep understanding of GRC-S principles and the ability to effectively demonstrate our software solutions to potential clients.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




 As a Senior Account Executive, you have an important role and responsibility in RISMA’s future growth and expansion in Sweden and the Nordics. 
 


* Your will focus on rapidly building the business and winning market shares through prospecting and engaging potential clients through outbound calls, emails, and other communication channels.
* You will play a key role in driving revenue growth by identifying new business opportunities, qualifying leads, and closing deals as well as cross selling to existing clients.
* Effectively communicate the value proposition of our GRC-S SaaS solutions and overcome objections to secure meetings and demos.
* Effectively present and demonstrate our software solutions.
* Maintain and utilize all the information in our up-to-date CRM system, Hubspot.
* You will manage the end-to-end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as C-level, as well as Head of Compliance, Risk Managers, CIO’s, CFO’s, DPO’s etc.
* Attend events and networking events.
* This, combined with the Swedish implementation team and your profound energy level, will ensure that your role will gain success.



  





  





**Required & Preferred Skills:** 




  




* If you have experience with Governance, Risk, Compliance &Sustainability that’s an advantage.
* Preferably 3+ years’ experience with SaaS solution sales.
* Hunter capabilities.
* Team player, high energy level and structure is a must in this position.
* Ability to establish trusted advisor relationships with business and decision makers.
* Ability to get In-depth industry knowledge and commercial and technical understanding of SaaS applications.
* Negotiation and closing skills.
* Ability to identify, nurture, and drive opportunities and deals with all customers.
* You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree within a relevant field.
* Fluent in Swedish and English and an understanding of the other Scandinavian languages.



  





  





**What’s in it for you?** 




 RISMA offer you a job in a fast-growing company on an exciting journey where we aim to double in size within the next few years. You will be joining a company with high ambitions that also aspire to make a positive difference for a greater corporate world.
 



 While we are growing as an organisation, it is equally important for us that our employees also grow by enabling/guiding them to achieve their full potential, which is why we will emphasise on your career path and growth in RISMA.
 



 You will be joining our Swedish team of talented, dedicated and highly passionate people, in a diverse, collaborative/inclusive, and inspiring culture, where we have a high degree of flexibility.
 



 RISMA is in Convendums Coworking spaces in the middle of Stockholm and offers both a gym and breakfast and a weekly “AW”.
 



  





  





**Interested?** 




 You can read more about RISMA at www.rismasystems.com and if you want to know more about the job, please contact
 **Sales Director – Sweden, Anna Fiebig at afie@rismasystems.com, or at (+46) 730 500 588** 




 Please submit your application and CV as soon as possible. Applications will be processed on an ongoing basis. Please note that all enquiries will be handled with confidentiality and that we will reply to the email address from which you send your CV.
 



  
 



**Deadline for application:** 
  As soon as possible
 



**Workplace:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Supplier Quality Professional
description:
**Your Title** 
 : Supplier Quality Professional
   

  

**Job Location** 
 : Sweden - Danderyd
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 Your responsibility is to ensure the quality of purchased material within your category. It includes investigating supplier-dependent deviations in production, following up on quality data, setting standards for quality control at suppliers, evaluating and verifying new and existing items, reviewing new and existing suppliers, and initiating and following up on complaint cases.
   

  

 You have daily contact and collaboration with Operational Buyer, Strategic Buyer and Project Buyer as well as collaboration with the R&D department.
   

  

 As Trimble operates in an international and dynamic environment, you are offered an exciting role with many international contacts. Some travel is included in the service.
   

  

**What Skills & Experience You Should Bring**
 The right person has an academic degree from a university and has relevant experience from a production company.
   

  

**Furthermore, We Wish**
* Several years of experience in supplier quality;
* Experience with quality methods and standards;
* Supplier audits;
* Very good English, both spoken and written, as well as good knowledge of Swedish.


**You As a Person**
 To succeed in the role, it is important that you have the ability to independently carry out activities towards set goals. You should be analytical, structured and used to handling a lot of data.
   

  

 As a person, we see that you are a social person who enjoys working in teams with others towards common goals. You are customer-focused, business-oriented and used to working at a fast pace in an international environment.
   

  

 Furthermore, you are driven and results-oriented with a great interest in quality assurance.
   

  

**Job Location**
 You will be working at our office in Sweden - Danderyd.
   

  

**About Trimble**
 Dedicated to the world’s tomorrow, Trimble is a technology company delivering solutions that enable our customers to work in new ways to measure, build, grow and move goods for a better quality of life. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose-built products and enterprise lifecycle solutions to industry cloud services, Trimble is transforming critical industries such as construction, geospatial, agriculture and transportation to power an interconnected world of work. For more information about Trimble (NASDAQ: TRMB), visit:
 *www.trimble.com*
****Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment****
 We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.
   

  

 We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.
   

  

*Trimble is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D*
**Trimble’s Privacy Policy**

title: Pricing Consultant
description:
We’re a growing team, and as we scale, so does our need to focus on expanding our Solution Center team. You’ll be joining a people-focused company, and as a
 **Pricing Consultant** 
 , you will belong to a team of problem solvers with extensive consulting and industry experience. Your duties and responsibilities will span technology design, stakeholder management, pricing strategy, delivery quality, process reengineering, and ad hoc analytics. You will build your own and the team’s technical and business acumen while driving substantial financial benefits to our clients’ bottom line.
   

  

 As a Pricing Consultant, you will belong to a team of problem solvers with extensive consulting and industry experience. Your duties and responsibilities will span pricing strategy, commercial process assessment, stakeholder management, and ad hoc analytics. You will build your own and the team’s technical and business acumen while driving substantial financial benefits to our clients’ bottom line.
   

  

**THE OPPORTUNITY**
* Lead all business/functional requirements workshops and gather, evaluate and document customer business needs and requirements.
* Demonstrate Vendavo software and share best pricing practices with the customer in the context of client’s requirements and value proposition
* Analyze and map client requirements based on Vendavo capability
* Produce high quality business requirements documentation per Vendavo methodology
* Work with the project team to implement the designed solution and deliver sustainable value to the customer
* Deliver “Train The Trainer” training to customer core teams
* Participate in other knowledge transfer to customers
* Identify / suggest improvements to internal requirements tools, templates and processes
* Leverage and contribute to corporate knowledge assets
* Develop product and domain knowledge and expertise


**THE SKILL SET**
* 3-5 years experience in B2B pricing, marketing, finance or related domain area
* Experience with applications implementation in pricing, marketing, or related areas
* Prior experience in developing and delivering presentations to various levels of an organization
* Be a great team player and enjoy intense working environments
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Preferably, high-impact experience in customer-facing, consultative roles in enterprise software or professional technology consulting firm in one or more of the following industry groups: wholesale/distribution, high tech, industrial manufacturing or chemicals/process industries
* Proficiency in the following would be a plus: JIRA, Visio and Agile methodology
* Prior experience in a functional lead role on a project team is preferred
* Experience with business requirements gathering and documentation
* Strong presentation, communication, interpersonal and facilitation skills.
* Assisting in planning, prioritizing and managing time to meet deliverables within customer agreed timeline and budget in a fast-paced environment. Assisting Technical Engagement Manager/Project Manager with controlling the project scope
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint


**THE VENDAVO STORY**
 Vendavo partners with the world’s leading companies to accelerate growth and profitability, advance innovation, and build more prosperous communities. Our powerful, cloud-based, AI-powered pricing, selling, and prescribing solutions empower global manufacturers and distributors like Ford, Avnet, and Medtronic to manage, optimize, and digitize their end-to-end commercial processes. But we offer so much more than software. Our proven, repeatable process, and passionate, experienced people accelerate value and drive profitable, unrivaled business outcomes for our customers. We are passionate about helping our customers deliver the right products, at the right prices, at the right time, for the right people.
   

  

**OUR SAAS PRODUCTS**
 Our B2B pricing and selling solutions include Vendavo Intelligent CPQ, Margin Bridge Analyzer, Profit Analyzer, Business Risk and Sales Alerts, Vendavo Sales Optimizer, Deal Price Optimizer, Vendavo Pricepoint, and Rebate & Channel Manager. You can learn more about our products here .
   

  

**OUR FUNDING**
 We are backed by two of the top high-tech private equity firms in the world, have excellent financial health, and boast the top SaaS retention in our space.
   

  

**OUR CULTURE & YOU**
 We collaborate with our customers unlike any others in our industry. Anchored in our values (Honor Our Commitments, Results Matter, Easy and Enjoyable, Innovative Wisdom, and Celebration of Community), we are growing, constantly innovating, and consistently driving sustainable outcomes for our clients and partners.
   

  

 Unlocking opportunities for our customers would not be possible without our employees. When you are part of Vendavo, you’re part of a company that’s committed to your growth and invested in your career. Diversity, inclusion, and celebration of community are at our core, and we come together to learn from each other and honor our commitments.
   

  

 EMEA and California residents applying for positions at Vendavo can see our privacy policy here .
   

  

**OUR TEAM IS GROWING. YOU WILL TOO.**

title: RF Engineer in Gothenburg
description:
**About the Opportunity**
-------------------------


We are looking for you as our next brilliant star within the RF field with interest in expanding your knowledge in different areas of forefront technology. Your development is in focus and you'll contribute to projects that have a great impact on society and a more sustainable future.


Your daily tasks might include:

* Designing HW & PCB for radios, radars, and antennas
* RF testing and verification
* Defining technology roadmaps
* Modelling and simulating wireless environments
* Instrument remote control
* Data analysis and visualization
* Reviewing technical documentation to meet customer needs

**What’s in it for You?**
-------------------------


Joining us, you'll become part of a purpose-driven team with strong core values and a diverse culture. We aim to be positive, dynamic, and forward-thinking, focusing on projects that make a positive impact. Our promise is to be responsive to needs and take care of what's important for our employees, clients and stakeholders. Our vision is to "Spark Brilliance" - by putting focus on projects and contexts that make a positive impact in both the smaller and bigger perspective.


We work in various fields like HW design, RF, radar, and software-defined radio, serving industries such as telecommunications, automotive, IoT, and MedTech.

**Who Are You?**
----------------


You're a rising star with a technical interest and an open mindset. To succeed, we believe you have:

* A degree in electrical engineering or similar
* Solid background in microwaves and RF
* Hands-on experience with RF instruments and measurements
* At least 4 years of industry experience or a PhD in a relevant field
* Fluency in English


Additional skills that we see as a bonus:

* Experience in antenna and PCB design
* Programming skills (Python, Matlab, C++)
* Experience with Agile teams and SAFe
* Mathematical background
* Knowledge in satellite communications, RFID, or IoT networks
* Familiarity with RF regulations and standards
* Experience drafting technical documents


As a person, you are:

* Good at communication
* Service-minded and feel that representing our brand and core values is a natural part of your mission
* Flexible and open to new projects and technologies

**About 2550 Engineering**
--------------------------

  

Founded in 2018 and part of Qamcom Group, we are located in Gothenburg with 39 skilled Engineers with different backgrounds and nationalities. Right now we aim to grow and are excited to meet you.  

  

If you would like to learn more, feel free to apply!

title: SW R&D Engineer
description:
**SW R&D Engineer**
===================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **This position reports to**


BL Ports Global Tech Manager

### **Your role and responsibilities**


You will be part of Marine and Ports in Västerås. ABB’s business for ports assists shipping companies to transfer containers in a reliable, quick and cost-efficient way. Ports is specialized in advanced automation and information systems for motion control of all types of container cranes. We are the leading supplier of crane systems and are active worldwide. In the large terminal automation projects we deliver electric and automation systems for 50 to 100 cranes, to the major container ports in the world. As product owner you report to KT5 Manager. You will be part of the Standard Software solutions team consisting of 10 highly skilled automation SW engineers, responsible for development of crane automation standard software for stacking cranes, development of our dynamic crane control, responsible for drives SW, our safety solutions and safety SW standardization for automated container cranes. The department has around 50% work in customer delivery projects and 50% R&D and product maintenance. In this role you will be responsible for Standard SW and Safety Standard SW, for Automatic Stacking Cranes (ASC) at KT5, ensuring that the ASC Standard is relevant to customer requirements. You will also be involved with setting up driving the technical roadmap for this Crane Type. Reporting to the KT5 manager, and handle communication to internal stakeholders. •Supports Engineering, Sales, Product Management and Customer Support on advanced product issues. •Maintains product roadmaps in cooperation with System Owners. •Develops new product features as concepts or feature specifications and participates in the development process. •Identifies, proposes, and perform product maintenance activities as part of the budget cycle. •Provides input and participates in discussions regarding technology content/development for current and future business, based on a solid understanding of ABB’s technology landscape, state-of-the-art external technology, and current/future customer need. •Supports creation of R&D project work packages for product area. •Maintains technical product documentation and application guidelines. •Ensures adherence to Technology Development Process. •Collects, analyzes, and evaluates information and data about technologies and market (ABB, competition, and academia) in cooperation with others.


### **Qualifications for the role**

* Experience from team lead
* Experience from leading agile teams is beneficial.
* Experience in SW development within automation area (PLC, embedded).
* Experience with Machine Directive (2006/42/EC) is beneficial.
* Work with Safety of machinery (ISO 13849-1) is beneficial
* Experience from control of automation systems or drives are valuable.
* You have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or relevant field together with experience as a Software Developer.
* Since you will work in a global company, you need to master English in both speech and writing, Swedish language skills are meriting.

### **More about us**


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

title: Customer Success & Engineer Lead
description:
**About Validio**


Validio provides the Data Trust Platform that stops unknown data issues from reaching your business. Our platform unifies Data Observability, Lineage, and Catalog—all into one interface which gives you full control over your data. If something breaks, Validio lets the right people know immediately and shows a direct path to resolution. Validio is used by world-leading companies including Truecaller, OfferFit, AB CarVal, and Voi.


Too many companies struggle to see return on their data and AI investments, caused by bad data and a lack of prioritization among data assets. We believe that the key to successful data and AI initiatives is to prioritize, validate and improve the data that actually matters to the business. For data to be useful, it needs to be trusted—both by business users and data teams.


Here, your colleagues consist of a senior team of data- and engineering professionals with diverse backgrounds from renowned research institutions, leading startups, and established tech companies. Named as one of the hottest start-ups in Stockholm by publications such as Wired, Validio is gearing up for expansion, and now you can be part of our journey!

 **About the role**


Validio is on an exciting growth journey and this is a rare opportunity for someone to build and lead our Customer Success & Engineer function from the ground up, meaning ownership of customer satisfaction and success. At Validio we work on some of the most exciting modern data infrastructure architectures and our customers challenge us with interesting new data quality validation and monitoring requirements continuously. As the complexity grows for both us and our customers, we are looking to our Customer Success & Engineer Lead to strategize and lead customers to solutions. This is done by use case discovery, data asset prioritization, establishing Validio ways of working, and educating users about our product.


As our Customer Success & Engineer Lead, you will manage our customer relationships, become a trusted technical advisor to our users, and contribute to Validio’s fast-growing success. You will be the voice of the user and collaborate closely with product and engineering to make sure key improvements are added to the roadmap. You must be able to capture and contextualize product feedback for our engineering and product teams, track issue resolutions, explain new feature enhancements, and mitigate/prioritize any pain points before they become critical issues. As the Customer Success & Engineer Lead you must be ready to work and have technical discussions with our customers, translating business requirements and map them into solutions that Validio’s platform can solve for. The goal is to help our customers to become successful and enthusiastic Validio champions.

**What you’ll do**

* Oversee the ultimate success of our customers and users, ensuring they realize the full potential of the Validio platform; clearly communicating and assisting with use case deployments and different data requirements
* Responsible for the overall relationship with assigned customers, which will include onboarding, increasing adoption, ensuring retention, and building trust and advocacy with our customers
* Meet and exceed commercial renewal and expansion and grow customer usage
* Proactively engage customers to ensure all needs are met and to troubleshoot and prioritize accordingly any issues our bugs
* Be the voice of the customer & user and advocate for their needs & product feedback internally
* Support product marketing initiatives such as developing customer stories, case studies, and references
* In addition, you might take additional projects to help improve the product and set processes to reduce the support load and streamline ways of working
* Maintain best-in-class retention rate.
* Drive G2 reviews
* Drive product adoption
* Increase customer testimonials

**We believe you have**

* +3 years of experience in customer success / sales engineering / solutions engineering in a B2B Software/SaaS company (ideally a data-centric product). Alternatively experience from Management Consultancy with focus on technical projects.
* Experience in recruiting, building and leading stellar CS teams
* History of driving outsized growth and upsell within accounts
* Demonstrated success maximizing customer retention and minimizing churn
* Top-notch verbal & written communication skills and excellent in English
* Ability to listen empathize with the customer; you pick up non-verbal cues and understand the tone of the conversation and how to communicate the right message to each member of the audience
* Excellent project management skills and demonstrated success working cross-functionally to drive complex projects to fruition
* Comfortable with ambiguity, creative, and incredibly resourceful. We are a startup and it will require you to learn quickly while creating new processes
* Ability to learn and internalize new technical concepts, in order to answer customer questions
* Can clearly articulate technical requirements to business requirements, and the other way around
* Not afraid to roll up the sleeves and drive day to day work yourself, e.g. testing customer configurations and guiding customers to set-up Validio

**Extra points if you have:**

* Experience in technical data role such as Data Engineering, Analytics Engineer, BI Analyst or similar or closely related data roles e.g. Data Engineer turned Customer Success
* Previous experience from early-stage startup of growth stage company

  

At Validio we strive to be an inclusive and diverse workplace and believe that different experiences are necessary for our growth as a company. We understand that great talent can come from anywhere and we encourage all who are excited about building the next level data trust platform to apply - regardless of your experience in listed areas!


Here you’ll find a hybrid working style, which for us means that you can choose if you want to come into our beautiful office or if you’d rather work remotely from home. We are all located in Sweden and we support your relocation here to join us if not here already! You can read more about our benefits on our career page and culture here. Lastly, we offer you the chance to be part of something truly amazing and with a world-class team, there is no limit to what we can achieve together.


Would you like to learn more about your future colleagues? Here is a link to our post, where you can find shorter interviews with our employees.

  

Begin your journey with us by clicking "Apply" below.

  

We can’t wait to meet you!

title: Field Service Engineer, Sweden (Mobile Water Solutions)
description:
With over 25 years of experience, NSI Mobile Water Solutions , part of Nijhuis Saur Industries (Saur Group), is a leading provider of temporary water and wastewater treatment services. We offer an alternative to fixed plants to help customers maintain continuity of supply to core operations and minimise downtime in a wide range situation 24/7, 365 days a year.

  

At NSI Mobile Water Solutions, we believe in “Professionalism, Communication, Teamwork, External Focus and Service Excellence”.

**Summary**

  

The Field Service Engineer, Sweden ensures that customers can use Mobile Water Solutions - rental equipment safely and efficiently to support an optimal performance. Activities include technical support installation, commissioning and maintenance services for mobile water treatment equipment that is rented out to customers. The role is tasked with creating technical documentation to support efficient operations, coordinating the implementation of rental management software, and managing the deployment, operation, and maintenance of our water technologies, all of which are essential for maintaining customer satisfaction and fostering positive relationships with clients and rental companies.


The Field Service Engineer reports to the Operations Manager, UK & Nordics.

 **Job Responsibilities:**

  

* Installation: Setting up and installing equipment at the customer's location, ensuring it functions correctly and safely.
* Maintenance: Performing routine maintenance and inspections to ensure that the equipment remains in good working condition during the rental period.
* Repairs: Troubleshooting and repairing equipment if it breaks down or experiences technical issues during the rental period.
* Customer Support: Providing technical support and guidance to customers regarding the proper use and maintenance of the equipment. Interact with customers to understand their equipment needs, provide guidance on equipment operation, and address any issues or concerns. Deliver excellent customer service and build strong relationships.
* Documentation: Maintaining detailed records of equipment maintenance and repairs, including service reports, parts replacements, and work performed. Creating and maintaining technical documentation, including manuals, specifications, and guidelines, to support operational activities. Preparing and providing documentation to clients to ensure safe delivery, installation, and operation of equipment.
* Equipment verification: Overseeing and participating in factory acceptance testing procedures to verify equipment performance and compliance.
* Safety Compliance: Ensuring that the equipment meets safety and regulatory standards and addressing any compliance issues. Creating and maintaining 5S strategies at the depot to ensure organizational efficiency and cleanliness.
* Training: In some cases, offering training to customers or rental staff on the proper operation and maintenance of the equipment.
* Inventory Management: Monitoring the inventory of rental equipment, ordering spare parts when needed, and coordinating with suppliers.
* Troubleshooting: Diagnosing and resolving technical problems efficiently to minimize downtime for customers.
* Reporting: Providing feedback to rental companies about the performance and condition of equipment, as well as suggestions for improvements or replacements.
* Rental Management Software: Implementing and coordinating rental management software to streamline operational processes and enhance customer experience.
* Performs other duties of similar nature and level as assigned.

**Job Requirements:**

  

* Vocational Diploma in Engineering or equivalent electrical work experience
* Proven work experience as Field Service Engineer (in the water industry) or a similar role (e.g., equipment maintenance, repair, or a related field)
* Knowledge of safety regulations and best practices to ensure a safe work environment.
* A good level of English and Swedish language to communicate effective and clear with both technical and non-technical personnel, including clients, team members, and supervisors.
* Knowledge of Google Application Suite and/or Microsoft Office software packages (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and diagnostic tools used in equipment servicing.
* Capability to work across cultures, borders, and different methods of executing business within an international team.
* Possess a valid Driver's License to drive in the region.

**Working for us means:**

  

We offer training and career development plans with competitive salary and benefits.


NSI Mobile Water Solutions is an equal opportunities employer. We invest in diversity, ensure equity and a sense of belonging in our inclusive culture. We have a zero-tolerance policy for harassment, bias or discrimination towards applicants and employees.

**Are you a recruiter?**

  

Please do not call or email us unless we have contacted you first. We believe that we can find our new colleagues ourselves, therefore agency support is not desired. Profiles and resumes sent unsolicited by agencies, even if you send them directly to a hiring manager, will be treated as direct applications from the candidate.


Join our #missionwater
